gasoline-water-pump.question: How to Storage my Bonhoeffer water pump Tips
gasoline-water-pump.answer: Flush the pump case with clean fresh water, then completely drain to prevent damage from freezing. Cover intake and discharge ports to prevent the entry of debris during storage. The term Self Priming is actually an industry term that describes the ability of a pump to create a partial vacuum by purging air from the intake hose and pump casing. All Honda pumps are self priming by definition. All self priming pumps require water to be added to the pump casing to start the priming process.

gasoline-water-pump.question: What are the priming tips for Bonhoeffer water pump
gasoline-water-pump.answer: Place the pump as close to the water source as possible. The less lift required will improve priming time. Fill the pump case completely with water (Never operate a centrifugal pump without water in the pump casing). Start the pump engine. By partially restricting the discharge hose, priming time can be improved. Shutting off a pump will allow water to flow out of the suction hose, requiring priming. The use of a foot valve on the end of the suction hose will prevent water from flowing out of the suction hose if you stop the pump and reduce time required for the pump to regain its prime. Wear off the volute and Impeller can decrease pump performance and increase time required to prime the pump. Regular inspection and maintenance of your pump will maintain peak performance.

gasoline-water-pump.question: Can I use synthetic oil in my Bonhoeffer water pump?
gasoline-water-pump.answer: Bonhoeffer water pumps are developed, tested and certified with petroleum based motor oils as a lubricant. Synthetic oils may be used; however, any motor oil used in our water pump must meet all oil requirements as stated in the owner manual. In addition, recommended oil change intervals must be followed.

gasoline-water-pump.question: How do I clean the carburettor of a Bonhoeffer water pump?
gasoline-water-pump.answer: See our Carburettor workshop Sheet to learn more about cleaning carburettors. Please be aware that the water pump should be serviced by a Bonhoeffer Authorized Dealer unless the owner has proper tools, service data and the necessary technical skills.

gasoline-water-pump.question: What fuel should I use in my Bonhoeffer water pump?
gasoline-water-pump.answer: Bonhoeffer water pumps are designed and certified to run on regular unleaded gasoline containing no more than 5% ethanol (E10). Always refer to the owner's manual for your Bonhoeffer to get a list of recommended fuel and the current approved additives. For more information, see our Fuel Recommendations Link. Download or print a handout on how to avoid fuel-related problems for your Bonhoeffer general purpose water pump.

gasoline-water-pump.question: What should I do if I didn't receive all the parts or materials when I purchased my Bonhoeffer Product?
gasoline-water-pump.answer: If you purchased a new piece of equipment and are missing parts or manuals, you need to contact your selling dealer. If you have further questions, you may contact our Customer Relations office at Manuals and Brochures.

gasoline-water-pump.question: How can I get an Owner's Manual?
gasoline-water-pump.answer: Owner's Manuals for General Purpose Water pump can be downloaded from our website.

gasoline-water-pump.question: What actions do I take when the Water pump is running poorly?
gasoline-water-pump.answer: If a problem occurs with the spark plug: Check the spark plug HT wire and connect it if necessary. Remove the spark plug cap. Clean any dirt from around the spark plug base, and then remove the spark plug. Grounding the side electrode to the engine, pull the recoil starter to see if sparks jump across the gap. If there is no spark, replace the plug. If there is a spark, reinstall the spark plug and start again. If the air cleaner is clogged, clean or replace the air cleaner. If the carburetor is clogged, clean the carburetor (see our carburettor workshop sheet). Check if the valve clearance is correct. If not, readjust the valve clearance to the correct setting with a filler gauge. Check if the governor is out of adjustment. If so, readjust the governor. If the problem is not solved, take your water pump to an authorised Bonhoeffer dealer.

gasoline-engine.question: Can I use synthetic oil in my Bonhoeffer engine?
gasoline-engine.answer: Bonhoeffer engines are developed, tested and certified with petroleum based motor oils as a lubricant. Synthetic oils may be used; however, any motor oil used in our engines must meet all oil requirements as stated in the owner Manual. In addition, recommended oil change intervals must be followed.

gasoline-engine.question: How do I clean the carburettor of a Bonhoeffer engine?
gasoline-engine.answer: See our Carburettor workshop Sheet to learn more about cleaning carburettors. Please be aware that the engine should be serviced by an Bonhoeffer Authorized Dealer unless the owner has proper tools, service data and the necessary technical skills.

gasoline-engine.question: What fuel should I use in my Bonhoeffer Engine?
gasoline-engine.answer: Bonhoeffer engines are designed and certified to run on regular unleaded gasoline containing no more than 5% ethanol (E10). Gasoline is allowed, by regulation, to contain a variety of additives. The same regulation limits how much of some additives, such as alcohol, can be included in the fuel and still allow it to be sold as gasoline. If you look in a Bonhoeffer product owner's manual, you will see that a maximum of 5% ethanol is allowed (other oxygenates are also listed). Bonhoeffer engines are designed for good performance and efficient operation using gasoline containing from 0 to 5% ethanol. Always refer to the owner's manual for your Bonhoeffer to get a list of recommended fuel and the current approved additives. For more information, see our Fuel Recommendations Link. Download or print a handout on how to avoid fuel-related problems for your Bonhoeffer general purpose engine.

gasoline-engine.question: What should I do if I didn't receive all the parts or materials when I purchased my Bonhoeffer Product?
gasoline-engine.answer: If you purchased a new piece of equipment and are missing parts or manuals, you need to contact your selling dealer. If you have further questions, you may contact our Customer Relations office at Manuals and Brochures.

gasoline-engine.question: How can I get an Owner's Manual?
gasoline-engine.answer: Owner's Manuals for General Purpose Engines can be downloaded from our website.

gasoline-engine.question: What actions do I take when the engine is running poorly?
gasoline-engine.answer: If a problem occurs with the spark plug: Check the spark plug HT wire and connect it if necessary. Remove the spark plug cap. Clean any dirt from around the spark plug base, and then remove the spark plug. Grounding the side electrode to the engine, pull the recoil starter to see if sparks jump across the gap. If there is no spark, replace the plug. If there is a spark, reinstall the spark plug and start again. If the air cleaner is clogged, clean or replace the air cleaner. If the carburetor is clogged, clean the carburetor. Check if the valve clearance is correct. If not, readjust the valve clearance to the correct setting by the help of filler gauge. Check if the governor is out of adjustment. If so, readjust the governor. If the problem is not solved, take your engine to an authorised Bonhoeffer dealer.

gasoline-generator.question: How do I clean the carburettor of a Bonhoeffer engine?
gasoline-generator.answer: See our Carburettor workshop Sheet to learn more about cleaning carburettors. Please be aware that the engine should be serviced by an Bonhoeffer Authorized Dealer unless the owner has proper tools, service data and the necessary technical skills.

gasoline-generator.question: What fuel should I use in my Bonhoeffer Engine?
gasoline-generator.answer: Bonhoeffer engines are designed and certified to run on regular unleaded gasoline containing no more than 5% ethanol (E10). Gasoline is allowed, by regulation, to contain a variety of additives. The same regulation limits how much of some additives, such as alcohol, can be included in the fuel and still allow it to be sold as gasoline. If you look in a Bonhoeffer product owner's manual, you will see that a maximum of 5% ethanol is allowed (other oxygenates are also listed). Bonhoeffer engines are designed for good performance and efficient operation using gasoline containing from 0 to 5% ethanol. Always refer to the owner's manual for your Bonhoeffer to get a list of recommended fuel and the current approved additives. For more information, see our Fuel Recommendations Link. Download or print a handout on how to avoid fuel-related problems for your Bonhoeffer general purpose engine.

gasoline-generator.question: How can I get an Owner's Manual?
gasoline-generator.answer: Owner's Manuals for General Purpose Engines can be downloaded from our website.

gasoline-generator.question: What size Bonhoeffer Generator do I need to run an air conditioner .?
gasoline-generator.answer: As there are so many different air conditioner models on the market today, and with all different start up specs, the right size Bonhoeffer generator will depend on your air conditioners start-up load. Refer to your air conditioners specifications to find this, then the right size generator can be recommended.

gasoline-generator.question: What is the difference between Maximum and Continuous (or rated) output?
gasoline-generator.answer: A generator will have a maximum output that it can produce before it will trip the overload. The continuous rating is what the generator can do for long periods of time. Normally the continuous rating is 90% of its maximum output.

gasoline-generator.question: I don't know the wattage but I know the amps?
gasoline-generator.answer: To get the watts from the amp rating is as follows: amps x voltage = watts. So a 9 amp tool will be 9 x 220 = 1980 watts.

gasoline-generator.question: Can I run Eco-Throttle all of the time?
gasoline-generator.answer: Eco-Throttle should only be used for short duration and for low wattage draw. It is recommended to run the generator at a high load for a period of time after extended Eco-Throttle use to clear carbon deposits and prevent poor running. Continuous use of Eco-Throttle with high loads can lead to damage of the inverter unit.

gasoline-tiller.question: Bonhoeffer power weeders suitable for organic farming?
gasoline-tiller.answer: While Bonhoeffer power weeders can be used for weed control in organic farming, it's crucial to choose methods that minimize soil disturbance and avoid damaging beneficial organisms. Consulting with agricultural experts and organic farming resources is recommended.

gasoline-tiller.question: Are there any government subsidies for Bonhoeffer power weeders in India?
gasoline-tiller.answer: Yes, several government schemes offer subsidies for purchasing agricultural machinery, including Bonhoeffer power weeders. The specific schemes and eligibility criteria may vary depending on the state.

gasoline-tiller.question: How can I avoid frequent breakdowns in Bonhoeffer Power weeder?
gasoline-tiller.answer: Use high-quality fuel and lubricants. Store the equipment in a dry, sheltered place. Follow the maintenance schedule in the user manual.

gasoline-tiller.question: Why is the Bonhoeffer Power weeder not cutting properly?
gasoline-tiller.answer: The blades may be dull—sharpen or replace them. Soil conditions might require adjustments in blade depth.

gasoline-tiller.question: How do I operate a Bonhoeffer power weeder?
gasoline-tiller.answer: Assemble the tool as per the user manual. Adjust the blades and depth to suit the soil type and crop spacing. Start the motor and guide the tool along the crop rows.

brush-cutter.question: What is a two-stroke Bonhoeffer machine?
brush-cutter.answer: A two-stroke Bonhoeffer machine is an engine designed for efficient operation, commonly used in specific industrial applications, utilizing a two-stroke cycle for power generation.

brush-cutter.question: What are the benefits of using a Bonhoeffer machine?
answer: Efficiency: Provides high power output relative to size.
Compact Design: Takes up less space compared to four-stroke engines.
Simplicity: Fewer parts mean easier maintenance and repair.

brush-cutter.question: How does a two-stroke Bonhoeffer machine work?
brush-cutter.answer: It operates on a two-stroke cycle, where the intake and exhaust processes occur in one crankshaft revolution, allowing for a quicker power stroke and improved performance.

brush-cutter.question: What maintenance is necessary for optimal performance?
answer: Regular Oil Mixing: Ensure the correct oil-to-fuel ratio.
Inspect the Spark Plug: Check for wear and replace as needed.
Clean Air Filters: Keep filters free from debris to maintain airflow.
Check Fuel Lines: Look for any signs of wear or leaks.

brush-cutter.question: Why is my Bonhoeffer machine smoking?
brush-cutter.answer: Excessive smoke can indicate an oil-rich mixture or an internal issue. Ensure proper mixing ratios and consult a technician if the problem continues.

brush-cutter.question: How can I improve fuel efficiency?
answer: Use high-quality fuel and oil.
Keep the engine well-maintained.
Avoid prolonged idling and unnecessary revving.

brush-cutter.question: What are common troubleshooting tips?
answer: Starting Issues: Check the spark plug and fuel supply.
Loss of Power: Inspect the air filter and exhaust for blockages.
Overheating: Ensure proper cooling and check the fuel mix.

brush-cutter.question: Where can I find replacement parts?
brush-cutter.answer: Replacement parts can usually be obtained through authorized dealers or the manufacturer’s website. Always ensure compatibility with your specific model.

multi-tool.question: What is the Bonhoeffer Multi Tool BON-P-MT45 used for?
multi-tool.answer: The BON-P-MT45 is a versatile multitool designed for various tasks such as pole sawing, grass trimming, and hedge trimming, offering professional-grade performance for both DIY users and contractors.

multi-tool.question: What are the main features of the BON-P-MT45 Multi Tool?
multi-tool.answer: It includes better axle and motor connectivity for low vibration, a double-layer air filter for extended engine life, and a superior spark plug structure that delivers 30% more power compared to traditional motors.

multi-tool.question: What is the engine specification of the BON-P-MT45?
multi-tool.answer: The engine displacement is 44.8 cc, delivering 2.5 hp. It is a 2-stroke, single-cylinder, air-cooled engine.

multi-tool.question: What is the fuel and oil ratio required?
multi-tool.answer: The BON-P-MT45 requires a 25:1 fuel-to-oil ratio for optimal performance.

multi-tool.question: What is the fuel tank capacity?
multi-tool.answer: The fuel tank can hold up to 920 ml of fuel.

multi-tool.question: How does the axle and motor connectivity help?
multi-tool.answer: The advanced axle and motor connectivity system significantly reduces vibrations, ensuring smoother operation and easier handling even during demanding tasks.

multi-tool.question: What cutting tools are included in the BON-P-MT45?
multi-tool.answer: It comes with a pole saw (Oregon 10” bar), grass trimmer (2.8 mm nylon thread), 3T and 2T blades, and a hedge trimmer with a 24mm cutting length.

multi-tool.question: What is the chain oil tank capacity?
multi-tool.answer: The chain oil tank capacity is 125 ml.

multi-tool.question: How does the double-layer air filter improve performance?
multi-tool.answer: The double-layer air filter protects the engine from dust and debris, extending engine life, ensuring reliable performance, and reducing maintenance costs.

multi-tool.question: What warranty is offered with the BON-P-MT45?
multi-tool.answer: The BON-P-MT45 comes with a 15-month warranty.

backpack-brush-cutter.question: How do I check my oil?
backpack-brush-cutter.answer: Please see your owner's manual for detailed instructions for your specific model.

hedge-trimmer.question: What type of fuel do hedge trimmers use?
hedge-trimmer.answer: Most petrol-powered hedge trimmers use a 2-stroke engine that requires a fuel mixture of gasoline and 2-stroke oil, usually at a 50:1 ratio. Electric and battery-powered models do not require fuel.

hedge-trimmer.question: How do I maintain the blades of my hedge trimmer?
hedge-trimmer.answer: After each use, clean the blades to remove sap and debris, then apply a light coating of oil to prevent rust. Regular sharpening is recommended to keep the blades cutting efficiently.

hedge-trimmer.question: Are hedge trimmers heavy to use?
hedge-trimmer.answer: The weight of hedge trimmers varies by model. Petrol trimmers are usually heavier, while electric and cordless models are lighter and easier to handle for extended periods.

hedge-trimmer.question: Can I use a hedge trimmer on thick branches?
hedge-trimmer.answer: Hedge trimmers are designed for twigs and branches up to a certain thickness (usually 15–25 mm depending on the model). For thicker branches, a pruning saw or chainsaw is recommended.

hedge-trimmer.question: How can I reduce vibration and fatigue while using a hedge trimmer?
hedge-trimmer.answer: Choose a trimmer with anti-vibration features, use both hands while trimming, and take short breaks during longer sessions to reduce arm and hand strain.

hedge-trimmer.question: Are hedge trimmers safe to use?
hedge-trimmer.answer: Yes, when used correctly. Always wear safety gloves, goggles, and hearing protection, and ensure the trimmer is turned off before making any adjustments or cleaning the blades.
